benchmark_details.name: Sieve: Multimodal Dataset Pruning Using Image Captioning Models
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces Sieve, a pruning method that utilizes synthetic captions from image-captioning models to improve dataset quality for Vision-Language Models by reducing false positives and negatives in image-text pair alignment.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve dataset quality for Vision-Language Models through effective pruning of noisy image-text datasets.

data.source: DataComp benchmark and web-crawled image-text datasets
data.annotation: Synthetic captions generated by image-captioning models

methods: Fused scoring from Sieve and CLIPScore
methodology.calculation: Uses cosine similarity between embeddings of generated captions and alt-text.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is interpreted based on improvements in classification and retrieval tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Surpasses CLIPScore by 2.6% on medium scale and 1.7% on large scale.
